terms.definition: A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
A web-based platform where users can find answers and resolve issues independently without contacting support staff
Technical content that explains how to use, install, configure, or troubleshoot a software product or service
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to revert to previous versions
A lightweight markup language that uses plain text formatting syntax to create structured documents
Customer Relationship Management - software systems used to manage interactions and relationships with customers
Access control settings that determine what actions different users can perform within a system or on specific content
A centralized support system that handles technical issues, questions, and requests from users or customers
An internal collaborative platform where employees can create, edit, and share organizational knowledge and documentation
Technical content that explains how developers can integrate with and use an Application Programming Interface
The ability of software tools to connect and work seamlessly within existing business processes and systems
A text editing interface that allows users to format content with styling options like bold, italics, and embedded media
The process of organizing and cataloging content to make it searchable and quickly retrievable by search engines
Instructional documents that provide step-by-step guidance on how to use a product or service
Software as a Service - cloud-based software applications accessed through web browsers rather than installed locally
